title: Chickamauga & Chattanooga National Military Park: Kids & Youth
body: Kids & Youth         Summer Day Campers Learn to March as Soldiers NPS  2016 Summer Day Camp for Kids Is your child interested in attending our 7th annual Summer Day Camp for Kids? It's that time of year again! This year we will be exploring the Civil War through new hands-on activities. Campers will finish the week by learning about the importance of preservation in the park and will participate in monument preservation efforts.  4th, 5th, & 6th graders camp dates are July 12 - 14. 7th & 8th graders camp dates are July 19 - 21. Campers will need to be signed in everyday by 9 am at the information desk inside Chickamauga Battlefield Visitor Center. Pick-up time will be at 1 pm. Lunch will not be provided, but campers are encouraged to bring drinks and snacks. This is a FREE camp, however, registration is required. The registration deadline for campers is July 8, 2016. Please complete the following forms (you may download them here, submit an e-registration form, or pick them up at Chickamauga Battlefield Visitor Center or Lookout Mountain Visitor Center):   Printable Registration Form (If you print and complete this form, please mail or fax to Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park)   E-Registration Form   Photo Release Form (If you are completing an e-registration form, please bring this form on the first day of camp)   Once you have completed the forms, please drop them off at Chickamauga Battlefield Visitor Center or mail them to: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Attn: Christopher Young P.O. Box 2128 Fort Oglethorpe, GA 30742 If you have any questions, please feel free to call Chickamauga Battlefield Visitor Center at 706-866-9241. Become a Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Junior Ranger by visiting both Chickamauga Battlefield and Lookout Mountain Battlefield. Ask the Ranger on duty at the information desk about the Junior Ranger Program. The two facilities have books, certificates, and badges. Be sure to visit both park visitor centers to become a Junior Ranger.
